subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Zhuangzi: The Philosopher Who Dreamed He Was a Butterfly
description: One-minute skill: Zhuangzi: The Philosopher Who Dreamed He Was a Butterfly.

hook.text: Am I a man who dreamed he was a butterfly, or a butterfly dreaming it's a man? Zhuangzi asked â€” and never answered.

buildup.text: Zhuangzi (369-286 BCE) was Taoism's greatest storyteller. His parables use humor and absurdity to teach wisdom.

discovery.text: His butterfly dream questions reality itself. If you can't tell dream from waking, what can you truly know?

twist.text: He laughed at death, mocked power, and celebrated uselessness. The useless tree survives because no one cuts it down.

climax.text: Zhuangzi shows that philosophy doesn't need to be serious. Laughter and wonder are valid paths to understanding.

punchline.text: A butterfly dream questioned reality. Zhuangzi made philosophy playful.

quiz.question: What was Zhuangzi's butterfly dream about?
options: The inability to distinguish dream from reality
